name: Assassin's Creed: Rogue Remastered
summary: In addition to running in 4K, Assassin's Creed Rogue Remastered sports higher-resolution textures and shadows, improved environmental rendering, and new visual effects, making its sprawling wilderness, Arctic icescapes, and bustling version of New York City more striking than ever. The new edition also packs in all of the original's downloadable content and expansions, including two bonus missions – The Armor of Sir Gunn and The Siege of Fort de Sable – as well as the weapons, outfits, and customization items in the Master Templar and Explorer packs. It also includes a new bonus: Bayek's legacy outfit from Assassin's Creed Origins.

esrb.synopsis: This is an action-adventure game in which players assume the role of an assassin facing conflicts in his brotherhood. Players explore open-world environments, travel to various ports, and engage in combat against European naval vessels. Players use concealed blades, firearms, swords, and explosives to kill human enemies. Players can also employ stealth kills (e.g., sneaking up and stabbing enemies from behind or dropping from above). Large blood splashes often appear when characters are attacked. Some sequences depict characters being shot in the head, with brief slow-motion effects, or civilians being impaled by bladed weapons—though killing civilians will raise the bounty on the player's character. The words “f**k” and “sh*t” appear in the dialogue.

pegi.synopsis: This game was rated PEGI 18 for some frequent strong violence. Not suitable for persons below 18 years of age.
